author: stefanbratanov
content: Hi, do you have any other WARN/ERROR logs a little earlier from Teku?

author: stefanbratanov
content: This error indicates there have been a problem with the fCu call the slot behind

author: somnergy
content: Some logs around a slot missed just now

author: somnergy
content: Alright, how do you handle a "SYNCING" status on fCu response from EL? This may include times when there is a request to build block (payloadAttributes != nil). Because i see some of those (could be erigon's fault too)

author: stefanbratanov
content: If we receive "SYNCING" that means that erigon didn't agree with our view of the fork choice state and deemed it as invalid, we don't receive a payloadId back in that case, so we can't build a block. I see lots of state regenerations in the logs as well, so overall it doesn't look very healthy. Looking at it from Erigon perspective could also help to identify what is happening.

author: somnergy
content: Well, the "INVALID" status is meant for that, "SYNCING" would simply mean it's dealing with a fork by downloading blocks that it does not have. But I/we (Erigon) have taken the liberty for it to also mean that the EL is just busy doing something else (maybe a background process or housekeeping), and may need a second to be fully ready to build the block. My assumption is, "SYNCING" should be followed up with another block-building request, within maybe half a second or so. What do you think?

author: tersec
content:
yeah
>  deemed it as invalid
is definitely not per spec

author: stefanbratanov
content: sorry was meaning to say it deems it as unknown or data is missing to validate it

author: parithosh
content:
Dora now support a new feature to visualize CL and EL peers and display them as a mesh (huge props to <@131476523050860545>!)

https://x.com/parithosh_j/status/1823348169180082668

https://dora.pectra-devnet-2.ethpandaops.io/clients/consensus
https://dora.pectra-devnet-2.ethpandaops.io/clients/execution


Peers we know about will have human readable names, the other rando peerIDs are peers from the wild
